Articles.Content:
I've been noticing this weird thing that appears in posts a lot that looks like this: --Updated-- At first, I thought this was someones weird way of saying 'edited', but then it started cropping up everywhere, including one of my posts. Am I the only one noticing this? Why does this happen?

Thanks!
I've been wondering too

When you basicly double post it pops up, When you post in the same thread without a post between in a short amount of time it happens.

- - - Updated - - -

Seeeeeeeeeee???

Really?! Never heard of that...

- - - Updated - - -

Testing.......

Whaaatttttt
Wait, that's a forum feature? I assumed it was an intentionally-done thing, too. That's pretty cool. I suppose Kasper or Sal are probably behind that one. Makes less work for us mods, hehe.

Huh, that's nice. Hopefully it'll crush some of those quad-post, intentional or unintentional.

Let me test it.

- - - Updated - - -

Hey yeah, it works!

- - - Updated - - -

Cool feature forum

- - - Updated - - -

Cool feature forum
hmmmmmmmmmmm It dosen't seem to merge after a certain time, allowing bumps. Still good.

Wait, that's a forum feature? I assumed it was an intentionally-done thing, too. That's pretty cool. I suppose Kasper or Sal are probably behind that one. Makes less work for us mods, hehe.

As a mod, I would think you would know this kind of stuff XD
Well, yeah. Anything big changes, we get a heads-up. But little stuff like this gets slipped under our noses unless it's being visibly tested somewhere, which happens on occasion.

Well, yeah. Anything big changes, we get a heads-up. But little stuff like this gets slipped under our noses unless it's being visibly tested somewhere, which happens on occasion.

Any other notable features that needs mentioning?

Apart from nifty little vBulletin features that aren't documented anywhere that makes life easier for us moderators and that I can't tell you? Eh, probably a few... Kasper and Sal would know better than I, but they pretty much never stop working, and fiddling with things. Stuff changes all the time; often too much trouble to keep careful track of.

Apart from nifty little vBulletin features that aren't documented anywhere that makes life easier for us moderators and that I can't tell you? Eh, probably a few... Kasper and Sal would know better than I, but they pretty much never stop working, and fiddling with things. Stuff changes all the time; often too much trouble to keep careful track of.

Ah, I see.... I was interested in pursuing that life.... In fact I still am. But there haven't been any openings, so I'm stuck here
Heh. Stand out enough in a good way, and maybe we'll think about it next time we have to figure out who we're going to go asking.

Heh. Stand out enough in a good way, and maybe we'll think about it next time we have to figure out who we're going to go asking.

I've got a few notable marks by mods, but I don't do it intentionally. Most of it would be "disagreement" with one group... That's the worst I can think of....

But I would hope that mods, being human, have made their minor traspasses.

Also, Vanamonde, my mod of choice for this kind of thing, is afk. So I'm gonna pm you something I would like looked at.

Eh, we do have to be pretty impartial. Keep it fair, and all.

I'm sure most of us have made minor mistakes here and there. I wonder if anything's on my record... I don't think so, though. Worst I got was back before Damion Rayne left; I got into an argument with some guy who made little to no sense. I eventually just gave up on reasoning with him and spoke to Sal about it, I think.

I suppose we make small mistakes here and there eventually, but we usually try to fix them up before anything gets outta hand.

Eh, we do have to be pretty impartial. Keep it fair, and all.

I'm sure most of us have made minor mistakes here and there. I wonder if anything's on my record... I don't think so, though. Worst I got was back before Damion Rayne left; I got into an argument with some guy who made little to no sense. I eventually just gave up on reasoning with him and spoke to Sal about it, I think.

I suppose we make small mistakes here and there eventually, but we usually try to fix them up before anything gets outta hand.

Same here... And besides, it's not the power I want, it's the fact I want to help that makes me interested in the position...

I can delete posts. Why would I need more? I heck don't want to ban someone unless I absolutely NEED to, as in if he is thing to destroy the forums and more.... But what else can I do? Close threads? Bah. It comes part of the job.

So I hope you get the feels, I want to help, not to abuse power.

I've considered moderating before, but they have to deal with a lot of stuff I don't want to deal with. And don't think the KSP forum is innocent, I've seen some nasty stuff from time to time. It's rare, but it happens.

From my experience it seems to only "update" if the post is made within a minute of the previous post. I am unable to edit on my computer, so this is useful, except when I miss the 1 minute mark. Maybe it could be extended?

- - - Updated - - -
